Complete Run

Run an elevation dem file through all functions to caculate watershed flow and fill patterns

complete_run(file, nrow, ncol, missing_value = -9999, max_area = 10,
  max_depth = 0.5, folder_out = NULL, clean = FALSE, xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL, continue = NULL, end = NULL, verbose = FALSE,
  quiet = FALSE)

Arguments

file

Character. Elev.dbf dem file
nrow

Numeric. Number of rows in dem file
ncol

Numeric. Number of columns in dem file
missing_value

Numeric/Character. Symbols which define missing data
max_area

Numeric. Largest area of pits to be removed during initial pit removal
max_depth

Numeric. Largest depth of pits to be removed during initial pit removal
folder_out

Charater. Folder to store output files. Defaults to location of dem file if not specified
clean

Logical. Remove all backup files and output files from previous runs?
xlim

Numeric vector. Column limits if specifying a subset of the dem
ylim

Numeric vector. Row limits if specifying a subset of the dem
continue

Character. If resuming a run, where to resume (see Details below)
end

Character. If ending a run after a particular step, which step (see Details below)
verbose

Logical. Output extra progress messages.
quiet

Logical. Suppress all messages.

Details

For resuming or ending a run, continue or end must be one of the following:

  1. directions (Calculating Directions)

  2. watersheds (Calculating Watersheds)

  3. watershed_area (Calculating Watershed Area

  4. local (Initial Pit Removal)

  5. pond (Calculating Pond Shed Statistics - Second Pit Removal)

  6. fill (Calculating Fill Shed Statistics - Third Pit Removal)

  7. inverted (Calculating Directions on Inverted DEM)

  8. iwatersheds (Calculating Inverted Watersheds)

  9. iwatershed_area (Calculating Watershed Area)

  10. ilocal (Initial Inverted Pit Removal)

Examples


# Basic Run
not_run({
  complete_run(file = "testElev.dbf", nrow = 100, ncol = 100)

  # Specify parameters for initial pit removal
  complete_run(file = "testElev.dbf", nrow = 100, ncol = 100,
               max_area = 5, max_depth = 2)
})
